subject: Swine Influenza
Soccer
lead_paragraph: All nine Mexican First Division games this weekend will be played behind closed doors, a move aimed at stemming the spread of swine flu. Three games last weekend around Mexico City were played without fans. The Mexican Football Federation said it will close off its games. Concacaf, soccer’s governing body in North and Central America and the Caribbean, said it was postponing its beach soccer championship, scheduled for Wednesday in Puerto Vallarta.
